column1: BIRD: Engineering an Efficient CNF-XOR SAT Solver and Its Applications to Approximate Model Counting

column2: Kuldeep S. Meel@National University of Singapore

column1: AAAI Technical Track: Constraint Satisfaction and Optimization

column3: also referred to as #SAT is to compute the number of solutions of φ. Model counting is a fundamental problem in artificial intelligence with a wide range of applications including probabilistic reasoning
column6: and the like. Motivated by the success of SAT solvers
column7: there has been surge of interest in the design of hashing-based techniques for approximate model counting for the past decade. We profiled the state of the art approximate model counter ApproxMC2 and observed that over 99.99% of time is consumed by the underlying SAT solver
column8: CryptoMiniSat. This observation motivated us to ask: Can we design an efficient underlying CNF-XOR SAT solver that can take advantage of the structure of hashing-based algorithms and would this lead to an efficient approximate model counter?
